result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl R. Beck Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (10 Days +), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Serve 80 days in the Pepin County Jail with no sentence credit.  Credit for good behavior.
Costs/surcharges waived based on ability to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl R. Beck Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Carl R. Beck in court with attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Defendant Carl R. Beck in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of charge/max. penalties constitutional rights and right to preliminary hrg.  Counsel informs court parties reached an agreement.  State will amend to 946.425(1r) Misdemeanor failure to report and parties have agreement and recommendation to serve 90 days jail with credit for 62 days already served.  Atty Rivard informs he's on probation on another matter and have a bed awaiting for him in February at Milwaukee Correctional for ATR but won't admit him with this open case.  Court notes defendant hasn't been held on this case for 62 days.  Court inquires State's thoughts on this amendment, why in public interest.  State addresses courts concern.  Off record.  On record.  Further discusions by counsel with negotiations, defendant will plead to charge as filed.  Defendant waives right to P.H. on the record, bound over for trial.  Counsel agrees to use the Complaint for the Information.  Court advises of charge/max penalties; felony prohibitions.  Defendant pleads guilty.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  Sentence to 80 days in the PCJ with no sentence credit with good time; waive costs based on ability to pay; advised of appeal rights.
Initial appearance on November 29, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in custody in Chippewa County on PO hold.  Court informs the DA to check if this warrant was served or not.  If the Sheriff's Dept. shows the warrant as served, inform the court.  Atty Rivard requests to get this matter going either by getting a transport order or doing this by video conferencing as that's what he thought was to happen today.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
Initial appearance on November 21, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
